newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine transsexual to run as municipal candidate.
newsitem.headline: Argentine transsexual to run as municipal candidate.

text.p: A transsexual legally recognised as a woman in Argentina announced on Friday she will run on the ruling Peronist party slate in October midterm elections.
"I will accept the candidacy for city councillor (for the Buenos Aires province suburb of Quilmes) which a Peronist group has offered me for the next elections," Mariel Munoz told reporters.

"Evita said 'I will return and I will be millions,' and I would like to be part of those millions and work for the people of Argentina and especially the children," Munoz said, referring to the charismatic wife of former president Juan Peron who was recently played by Madonna in a big budget film.
A judge recently officially reclassified Munoz as a woman after a sex change operation, setting a legal precedent in Argentina.
According to the judge, Munoz underwent the operation to make her appearance match "her real psychological gender."
